001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
008import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandGroupBase.requireUngrouped;
009
010import java.util.Map;
011import java.util.function.Supplier;
012
013/**
014 * Runs one of a selection of commands, either using a selector and a key to command mapping, or a
015 * supplier that returns the command directly at runtime. Does not actually schedule the selected
016 * command - rather, the command is run through this command; this ensures that the command will
017 * behave as expected if used as part of a CommandGroup. Requires the requirements of all included
018 * commands, again to ensure proper functioning when used in a CommandGroup. If this is undesired,
019 * consider using {@link ScheduleCommand}.
020 *
021 * <p>As this command contains multiple component commands within it, it is technically a command
022 * group; the command instances that are passed to it cannot be added to any other groups, or
023 * scheduled individually.
024 *
025 * <p>As a rule, CommandGroups require the union of the requirements of their component commands.
026 *
027 * <p>This class is provided by the NewCommands VendorDep
028 */
029public class SelectCommand extends CommandBase {
030  private final Map<Object, Command> m_commands;
031  private final Supplier<Object> m_selector;
032  private final Supplier<Command> m_toRun;
033  private Command m_selectedCommand;
034
035  /**
036   * Creates a new selectcommand.
037   *
038   * @param commands the map of commands to choose from
039   * @param selector the selector to determine which command to run
040   */
041  public SelectCommand(Map<Object, Command> commands, Supplier<Object> selector) {
042    requireUngrouped(commands.values());
043
044    CommandGroupBase.registerGroupedCommands(commands.values().toArray(new Command[] {}));
045
046    m_commands = requireNonNullParam(commands, "commands", "SelectCommand");
047    m_selector = requireNonNullParam(selector, "selector", "SelectCommand");
048
049    m_toRun = null;
050
051    for (Command command : m_commands.values()) {
052      m_requirements.addAll(command.getRequirements());
053    }
054  }
055
056  /**
057   * Creates a new selectcommand.
058   *
059   * @param toRun a supplier providing the command to run
060   */
061  public SelectCommand(Supplier<Command> toRun) {
062    m_commands = null;
063    m_selector = null;
064    m_toRun = requireNonNullParam(toRun, "toRun", "SelectCommand");
065  }
066
067  @Override
068  public void initialize() {
069    if (m_selector != null) {
070      if (!m_commands.keySet().contains(m_selector.get())) {
071        m_selectedCommand =
072            new PrintCommand(
073                "SelectCommand selector value does not correspond to" + " any command!");
074        return;
075      }
076      m_selectedCommand = m_commands.get(m_selector.get());
077    } else {
078      m_selectedCommand = m_toRun.get();
079    }
080    m_selectedCommand.initialize();
081  }
082
083  @Override
084  public void execute() {
085    m_selectedCommand.execute();
086  }
087
088  @Override
089  public void end(boolean interrupted) {
090    m_selectedCommand.end(interrupted);
091  }
092
093  @Override
094  public boolean isFinished() {
095    return m_selectedCommand.isFinished();
096  }
097
098  @Override
099  public boolean runsWhenDisabled() {
100    if (m_commands != null) {
101      boolean runsWhenDisabled = true;
102      for (Command command : m_commands.values()) {
103        runsWhenDisabled &= command.runsWhenDisabled();
104      }
105      return runsWhenDisabled;
106    } else {
107      return m_toRun.get().runsWhenDisabled();
108    }
109  }
110}
